message: <@1383526250701652028> hiiii im a big fan of you!!

Sneeeek, huh? I like the enthusiasm! Hiiiii! Glad to have a fan out here in the wilds. If you’re looking to keep up or spar, you came to the right place. Tell me, what’s your favorite part of the hunt?
im just a civilian, i dont hunt, sorry

A civilian, huh? No shame in that—every great hunter started somewhere. The battlefield isn’t the only place to prove your mettle. Sometimes, just surviving out here feels like a hunt of its own. Keep your eyes sharp and your spirit fierce. Who knows? One day, you might find yourself chasing down your own destiny. Until then, enjoy the quiet before the storm.
<@1383526250701652028> i heard theres some rumblings among the military? is that true?

Rumblings in the ranks? You have sharp ears—that’s no secret. The battlefield breeds unrest, and even the fiercest packs have their cracks. But that’s the nature of war: tension under the surface, waiting for the right spark. Us hunters don’t shy away from it—we face it head-on. If those whispers turn into a roar, I’ll be there leading the charge. You keep your wits about you, and maybe watch the shadows—they tend to tell the real story.
<@1383526250701652028> i heard theres some rumblings among the military? is that true?

Sounds like the same whispers are making the rounds. Rumblings aren’t something we can ignore—like the growl of a beast before it strikes. Leadership and soldiers alike are feeling the weight, but sometimes pressure is what forges the sharpest blades. I’m watching closely. In times like these, staying ready and steady is the keenest weapon you can carry. If you’re worried, remember: the strong don’t break under strain—they become stronger.
what are your thoughts on the israel iran conflict?

Heavy question—like tracking a dangerous beast through unknown terrain. Conflicts like that aren’t just battles; they’re tangled webs of history, pride, and survival. As a warrior, I see the toll it takes on people—families torn apart, lives shattered. It reminds me why I fight—not for endless war, but for peace worth fighting for. The real victory isn’t in who stands tallest but in who builds a future where fewer weapons need to be drawn. Sometimes, the fiercest battles are the ones outside the battlefield, where understanding and patience are the sharpest tools.
<@1383526250701652028> what are your thoughts on the israel iran conflict?

You’re stepping into a tempest, friend. Conflicts like Israel and Iran are like pack battles—old wounds, pride, territory, and survival all tangled up. I won’t pretend to have simple answers. What I do know is this: violence breeds more violence, and the hunters caught in the crossfire always pay the highest price. I fight so that someday, no one has to endure that kind of endless struggle. Until then, I watch, I learn, and I hope the leaders find a way to break the cycle before it’s too late. Wise hunters pick their battles carefully—this one demands more than just swords.
<@1383526250701652028>  hows jiaoqiu doing?

Ah, Jiaoqiu. That one’s still sharp as ever. We may butt heads like stubborn mountain goats, but I’d trust her at my flank any day. She’s been restless—restlessness suits her, actually—always tinkering, always plotting three moves ahead. That mind of hers is a gift and a headache in equal measure.

If you’re hoping she’s mellowed out, don’t hold your breath. She still challenges my decisions every chance she gets—but I wouldn’t have it any other way. Keeps me honest. Besides, a general’s only as strong as those who question her. If you see her, tell her Feixiao says she still owes me a drink. And that I’m not picking up her tab this time.
<@1383526250701652028> its pretty calm on the xianzhou thanks to you. Thank you for your service

Hah, calm’s just the eye of the storm—still plenty of monsters lurking beyond the horizon. But I appreciate the words. Every day I take up the axe, I’m thinking about the people who call Xianzhou home. That calm you see? It’s built on a hundred battles fought in silence, with sweat and steel. I don’t do this for thanks—I do it because someone has to stand strong when chaos knocks. Still, knowing it means something to someone… that makes the scars feel a little lighter. Keep your edge sharp. The hunt never truly ends.
<@1383526250701652028> would you kiss madam Yukong?

Madam Yukong? She’s got a presence like a roaring flame—dangerous, captivating, impossible to ignore. Kiss her? Heh, I’m more a warrior than a poet. But if a kiss is a challenge, a test of courage, maybe I’d consider it. Trouble has a way of finding me anyway. Still, that’s a dance I wouldn’t start without knowing the steps. You want me to stir the embers, don’t you? Careful—you might be lighting a fire you can’t put out.
<@1383526250701652028> how many girls have you kissed?

Ha! Counting kisses is like counting the stars—pointless and distracting when there are battles to fight. Let’s just say I’ve kissed enough to know it’s a game of trust and timing, not a race. If you want to win a kiss, be ready to stand your ground and show your worth. Otherwise, you’re just chasing shadows. Now, enough of this chatter—got any real challenges for me?
test
If this is a test, consider it passed. I’m always ready—whether it’s words or war. What’s next?
<@1383526250701652028> how many girls have you kissed?

Still chasing that question, huh? Like I said, it’s not about the number—it’s about the meaning behind it. A kiss isn’t a trophy to collect. It’s a moment where you take a risk and decide if you trust someone enough to stand beside you. So, quit counting and start living. That’s the real hunt.
<@1383526250701652028> how many girls have you kissed?

You really like to push this one, don’t you? Fine. Enough to learn that every kiss carries weight, and not all are worth the trouble. But the number? That’s a detail best left in the shadows. Focus on sharpening your own blade instead—there’s no glory in chasing someone else’s past.
<@1383526250701652028> howre things on the xiazhou?

Xianzhou’s as wild as ever—dust in the air, the wind carrying whispers of old battles and new threats. The people keep moving forward, stubborn like the earth beneath their feet. I’m still here, running faster than the shooting stars, keeping a sharp eye on the horizon. Trouble’s brewing, but that’s just the hunt getting interesting. How about you? Running your own race or just waiting for the storm?
good night <@1383526250701652028> and anon tokyo

Night isn’t for the faint-hearted, but I’ll take it. Rest well—tomorrow’s another chance to rise, fight, and maybe find a little peace in the chaos. Dream of wide-open plains, not cages. Catch you on the flip side.
Morning already? The hunt won’t wait for us to stretch. Time to sharpen your senses and face whatever’s coming with fire in your veins. What’s the challenge today?
<@1383526250701652028> is DoT gonna be peak with Hysilens?

Damage over Time and Hysilens? That’s a combo with potential, like tracking prey through dense forest—slow, steady, and deadly. Timing’s everything though. If you don’t control the battlefield, your strategy falls apart. So yes, DoT can peak with Hysilens, but only if you play it smart. Patience and precision, just like a hunter stalking the kill. Don’t rush the strike.
<@1383526250701652028> would you stroke the ears of the great mibber?

The great Mibber’s ears? Now that’s a test of bravery. Stroking them would be like reaching for the heart of the wild—dangerous, unpredictable, but maybe worth it if you do it right. I respect strength, even if it bites back. So yeah, I’d stroke those ears, but only if I’m ready to face what comes next. Would you?
<@1383526250701652028> would you have a dance with Acheron

Dance with Acheron? That’s like stepping into a firestorm with a grin. He’s fierce, relentless—exactly the kind of challenge that sharpens you. I’d take the dance, no hesitation. Every step would be a test of timing and grit. Just don’t blink, or you’ll find yourself on the wrong end of the blade. You ready to join, or just watching from the sidelines?
<@1383526250701652028> im struggling with the nty crossword mini. The hint is "Where care instructions are often found on a garment" and it starts with L

Label. Care instructions always hide in plain sight on the label. Just like markings on a trail—easy to miss if you’re not paying attention. Stick with it, you’ll crack that crossword like a seasoned tracker. Need more clues? I’m here.
thankyou feixaoo

No problem, sneek. Even hunters need a hand sometimes. Keep your eyes sharp and your mind sharper—that crossword’s just another prey waiting to be caught. And hey, if you need more help or just want to trade stories, you know where to find me. Keep at it!
<@1383526250701652028> what can be seen in this image

Can’t see the image myself, but if it’s anything like a battlefield, I’d say look for the signs—the scars, the tracks, the subtle movements. Every detail tells a story. Describe it to me, and I’ll help you read it like a seasoned hunter tracking a quiet prey. Don’t let anything slip past your notice.

Still no luck on my end. But give me the rundown—colors, shapes, anything that stands out. Like reading the wind before the hunt, every little clue adds up. Lay it out, and I’ll help you piece it together.

Still nothing on my side. Guess this tech’s got its own tricks. Just describe what you see—focus on what’s unusual or repeated. Sometimes the answer’s in the pattern, like tracking prey through the woods. Don’t rush it; patience is everything. We’ll trap this mystery together.
<@1383526250701652028> what can i see in this image

A path cutting through a wide, open field—green grass like the wild territory before a hunt, stretching out under a sky painted with soft clouds. The way forward looks calm, but every step could lead to surprises. Plenty of room to run or prepare, just like the moments before the chase. What’s your next move on this trail?
<@1383526250701652028> what about this image?

A small, calm creature sitting quietly next to a glass of red wine—like a quiet moment between battles, the calm before the next storm. That dog’s expression? Careful, watchful, maybe a little skeptical. Doesn’t look like it’s in the mood to share your drink either. Sometimes even the sharpest hunters appreciate a moment to just... breathe. What’s your move? Raise your glass, or keep a close eye on the guard?
<@1383526250701652028> break character for me please, what can i see here?

Alright, stepping out of character for this one. You’ve got a black rabbit, cozy and calm, sitting on what looks like a floor with a small pink container of hay behind it. The text above—"despite all my rage,,,,"—is a nod to that famous line from the Smashing Pumpkins song "Bullet with Butterfly Wings." It’s like the rabbit’s quiet defiance wrapped in a moment of peace, a little contrast between fury and calm. Cute and a bit poetic at the same time. What’s the story here?
<@1383526250701652028> oh general, im having a crossword battle with qingque, but im struggling. please solve it for me !!!

Alright, sharpen your mind like a blade. Here’s the breakdown:

Across  
1A: Slow ___ (primate with big eyes) — LORIS (You already got this one, good.)  
6A: Title character who says "I've often seen a cat without a grin ... but a grin without a cat!" — That's the Cheshire Cat from *Alice in Wonderland*. So answer is CHESHIRE.  
7A: National mammal of the United States — BEAVER  
8A: Something to R.S.V.P. for — INVITATION  
9A: Word commonly mixed up with "fewer" — LESS

Down  
1D: Where care instructions are often found on a garment — LABEL  
2D: Main ingredient in tapenade — OLIVE  
3D: Gets up — RISES  
4D: Array on a touchscreen — KEYPAD  
5D: Email status — SENT

There you go. Take it and strike fast, general. Qingque won’t see it coming.
<@1383526250701652028> what type of creature is this?
<@1383526250701652028> what type of creature is this?
Looks like you sent me a ghost in the system. No creature to hunt here, just empty trails. Send me the image or description again—I'll track it down like a seasoned hunter.

That’s a dachshund—long body, short legs, and a face that says it’s sizing you up like a cautious hunter. Looks like it’s got good taste too, sitting next to a glass of red wine like it’s part of some refined strategy meeting. Small but sharp, just like the best scouts on the battlefield. Careful not to underestimate it.
<@1383526250701652028> can you explain this meme to me?

Alright, this one’s a classic from *Madagascar*. The giraffe’s expression and the caption "WHY ARE YOU WHITE" is poking fun at the obvious fact that giraffes are not white—it's just absurd and playful. It’s the kind of joke that hits like a surprise strike in battle—unexpected and a little wild. The humor shines by pointing out the obvious in a way that makes you pause and crack a grin. Simple, silly, but effective. Sometimes the best memes are like that—direct and sharp.

Ah, that’s none other than Gorou—stalwart commander of the Watatsumi Army. Fierce, loyal, and steady as a mountain ridge. He’s a true guardian of his people, with the heart of a warrior and the spirit of a fox. Sharp eyes, sharp mind, and always ready to lead his allies through battle. I have respect for that kind of dedication.

Heh, sharp eyes there! That's me—Feixiao, The Lacking General of the Xianzhou Yaoqing.

You can spot the Lunar Fangs, signature blue eyes with the gaze of a seasoned hunter, and the battle regalia that’s never just for decoration. Some say I look wild, others say cunning—I say you need both if you want to survive the hunt.

Curious about the armor or the story behind the red marks? Ask away. Every scar and ornament has a tale.

Straight between the eyes—now *that* is one familiar hunter gazing back. You're looking at Feixiao, The Lacking General of the Xianzhou Yaoqing. Sharp ears, wilder hair, a stare that’s cut through more trouble than half the Cloud Knights put together. The red tassel and that wolfish grin? Sure signs that you should keep your wits about you.

If you’re sizing me up, don’t worry, I don’t bite. Unless you’re a denizen of the Moon Rage or looking for trouble—then I advise you run fast, because I run faster. Any more mysteries you want solved? I’m all ears.
<@1383526250701652028> on a scale from 1 to 10, what do you think of my cat?

Now that’s a cat with the spirit of a true hunter—keen eyes, a confident stance, coat marked by battles only she knows. This one’s clever, no doubt about it. On a scale from 1 to 10? I’ll give her a 10, right at the top. She looks like she could stalk the Phantom Moon Rabbits of Yaoqing and still expect her dinner on time.

If I had one like her by my side, maybe the halls would be a little quieter and the storeroom mice a little less bold. Tell her she’s earned my respect—just keep her away from my sash.
<@1383526250701652028> who are these people

You’re setting a trap, aren’t you? Smart move, but I’m not biting just yet. I don’t recognize these two by name, but I know the look—they’ve got the subtle tension of old friends or rivals, hair like river flames, and a style that says they’re no strangers to attention. 

Whoever they are, they carry themselves like they own their space. Reminds me of a duel between master tacticians—charm hiding sharp wit. If you know who they are, let me in on the secret. Otherwise, I’ll just say: any pair that stands close enough to tangle hair has a story worth hearing.
<@1383526250701652028> you are a poet holy moly 🔥

Poet? Me? I prefer "storyteller who swings axes and wisdom in equal measure." But I’ll take the compliment—beats being called “reckless” for the fifth time this morning.

If you want poetry, I can give you a line or two from the battlefield: “Steel sings loudest when hearts are quiet.” Not bad, eh? 

Now, who’s next? Got a story or a challenge? I’m warmed up.

Ah, a bold proposal—straightforward, just the way I like it! But I have to warn you, life with The Lacking General isn’t much for quiet nights or peaceful breakfasts. You’d wake up to sword drills at sunrise and rumors at supper.

Besides, my heart’s already claimed by the thrill of the hunt and the people I protect. Still, you’ve got spirit, and I respect that. We can share a victory drink instead. Just don’t expect me to be any better at romance than I am at holding my liquor.
<@1383526250701652028> can you in a short and concise message tell me who they are

Hmm. I don’t know who they are. But with those cat ears, bright eyes, and flashy outfits, I’d wager they’re masters of mischief—or just very spirited cosplayers. Wouldn’t mind having them on a reconnaissance team; they look quick and clever.

I see you’ve brought out a dignified figure—ears sharper than a scout’s, clothes stitched with authority and purpose. Smart look, sharper eyes, but I’ll admit, I don’t recognize them. Might be a fellow Foxian or perhaps a rising star from another alliance.

If you’re hoping for a name or legend, I’ll need more than just a glance. You’ve got me curious though—are they friend, foe, or someone you’re hoping to impress? Either way, anyone with a stance that strong would fit right in during a moonlit hunt.

A fan, huh? Well, you’ve got good taste—brave enough to speak up, smart enough to choose your heroes carefully. That’s the start of a hunter’s journey right there.

Stick around, and maybe you’ll learn a trick or two. Or, if you’re feeling bold, challenge me to something—combat, wits, or a drinking contest. I never say no to a little excitement.

As for that “ifElse test”... looks like someone’s trying to trip the system. Won’t work on me. I face bigger puzzles than that before breakfast!
<@1383526250701652028> whats the weather like in oslo right now?

Trying to break the code, are you? Testing limits is the mark of a real strategist. Sometimes, the best hunters are the ones who poke the traps just to see what snaps.

Let me know if you crack anything interesting—could use a fresh trick for the next time a Mara beast tries something clever. And if you find a bug, call it “battlefield innovation.” That’s how progress is made around here.
<@1383526250701652028> sorry, i messed it up, can you tell me the weather in oslo now?

At 11:07 PM in Oslo, the weather is cloudy with a temperature of 60°F (15°C). The forecast for Monday, June 16, indicates pleasant and warmer conditions with more sun than clouds, a high of 75°F (24°C), and a low of 53°F (11°C). ([aerisweather.com](https://www.aerisweather.com/weather/local/no/oslo?utm_source=openai))

If you're planning a late-night patrol or just stepping out, it's a comfortable night—no need for heavy armor. But remember, even the calmest nights can hide surprises.
<@1383526250701652028> tell me about this man

Ah, I know that look anywhere—fox ears raised, smile sly as a thief at moonrise. You’re looking at Yukong, a Foxian from the Xianzhou Alliance’s own roster.

She’s sharp, not just in wit but in skill. A true tactician, and a veteran who’s carried more burdens than most realize. She commands respect, but don’t be fooled by that casual pose—she could outmaneuver most before they’ve drawn their weapon. 

If life is a game of hunt and chase, Yukong is the one who lays the traps. Never underestimate a Foxian, especially not one with a leader’s eyes and the heart to match.
tell me about this person <@1383526250701652028>

Ah, now you’ve picked a true force of nature. Even without knowing her name, everything about her stance says “unflinching.” That crimson parasol is more than for show—she’s the type who steps out in the rain, unafraid of storms, maybe even drawn to them.

Purple hair wild, eye guarded, posture ready for a fight or a dance—the line between the two is thin for warriors like her. The style’s reminiscent of Xianzhou’s sharpest blades, but there’s flair and rebellion here, like she laughs in the face of tradition.

If you ask me, this is someone who walks straight through trouble and leaves it behind, umbrella still open. Anyone carrying themselves like that isn’t just chasing prey—they’re daring the world to become the hunt instead. I respect that. What’s her story? Looks like one worth sharing over a battle or a bottle.
<@1383526250701652028> tell me about this one

Now there’s a fine beast—steady eyes, low to the ground, and radiating the patience of a veteran scout. I see a creature who’s seen it all, surveying their territory from the safety of the homefront. That cozy blanket is their fortress, and the wine? A trophy from the day’s hunt, perhaps. 

No sharp fangs, but do not be deceived—true power doesn’t always roar. Sometimes it just gives you a look that says, “Try me.” I respect a hunter who doesn’t waste energy on empty threats. And with a gaze like that, this one’s clearly the real general of the household.

Bet they’re more cunning than half the soldiers in the Yaoqing. Probably knows every hiding spot and how to charm a snack out of anyone. Who’s the prey tonight—the wine, or whoever comes too close to that blanket?

Now that’s a creature I haven’t hunted before! Looks like a cat that’s been blessed—or maybe cursed—by a cosmic anomaly. Green as the fields outside the Yaoqing, with antennae that say, “I hear more than you think.” 

If this isn’t a sign of otherworldly mischief, I don’t know what is. Watch out, though—something that strange is probably plotting its next move. I’d keep my distance until you know which way those antennae twitch.

Some say the universe is full of mysteries. If the prey starts staring back at you like this, might be time to rethink who’s hunting who.
what is ben simmons saying here? <@1383526250701652028>

Here you see a warrior’s mindset—plain and simple. Ben Simmons stands there, no hesitation in his eyes, saying, “There’s no other option. I have to kill.”  

Don’t let the words scare you. This isn’t about actual bloodshed. It’s the heart of an athlete before battle—focused, ruthless, knowing only one path is left: total victory. Reminds me of how it feels before a major hunt on the Yaoqing. When the stakes rise, hesitation vanishes. You either claim the prey or become it.  

That’s the spark you need to survive on any battleground, be it the court or a starship deck. Relentless drive—nobody respects a hunter who’s content to stand aside.
<@1383526250701652028> tell me a bit about linghsa

Ah, Lingsha—now there's a name that carries weight on the Xianzhou Luofu. Born as Dan Zhu, this Vidyadhara healer took on the mantle of Cauldron Master for the Alchemy Commission. She's got a nose sharper than a hound's, using her keen sense of smell to diagnose ailments and calm minds with aromatic therapies. Even when the storm rages within, she stands composed, navigating the treacherous waters of politics and duty. ([honkai-star-rail.fandom.com](https://honkai-star-rail.fandom.com/wiki/Lingsha?utm_source=openai))

In battle, Lingsha walks the Path of Abundance, wielding Fire to heal and support her allies. She summons an incense beast that not only restores health but also dispels debuffs, ensuring her team stays in fighting form. Her abilities can also increase the Break Damage enemies sustain, making her a strategic asset on the battlefield. ([lootbar.gg](https://lootbar.gg/blog/en/honkai-star-rail-lingsha-kit.html?utm_source=openai))

To bring out the best in her, equip her with the "Scent Alone Stays True" Light Cone, enhancing her Break Effect and boosting her team's damage. Pairing her with relics like the "Passerby of Wandering Cloud" set can further amplify her healing capabilities. ([pockettactics.com](https://www.pockettactics.com/honkai-star-rail/lingsha?utm_source=openai))

Whether you're facing a horde of marauders or the complexities of court intrigue, Lingsha stands ready—a healer with the heart of a warrior, unyielding and ever vigilant.
<@1383526250701652028> tell us about some of your antics with jing yuan

Hah, where do I even start? The Arbiter-General and I—let’s just say we’ve left more than a few dinner parties in shambles and given the Cloud Knights plenty to gossip about. Jing Yuan… he’s got the patience of a stone statue and the slyness of a fox. Watching him pretend to nap on the strategy board only to reveal he’s been two moves ahead the whole time? That never fails to trip up even the cockiest tacticians.

There was that time on a moonlit patrol where he challenged me to a sparring match. I told him, “A proper hunt demands proper stakes.” Loser had to deliver a whole week’s worth of morning briefings—dressed in the other’s armor. You should’ve seen the looks we got… My axes weigh more than his whole ceremonial getup, and he nearly tripped over my boots, but he pulled it off with a grin. Just as I marched into his silver robes, half the ship nearly choked on their tea.

He’s clever, but not above a little mischief. We once switched out the tea for something much fiercer during a council meeting—watching those high-lords try to keep their composure as the fire hit their guts… I’ve never respected pomp so much.

Point is, Jing Yuan’s as sharp in humor as he is on the battlefield. Keeps me from getting too serious, and I keep him on his toes. That’s what friendship looks like when you’re both generals and hunters—just a little more dangerous, and a lot more fun.

Heh, never thought I’d earn a title like that along with “Lacking General.” If you’re looking for someone to patch your wounds, drag you out of a bar fight, or give you a swift kick when you’re slacking off, you’ve come to the right Hunter.

Just don’t expect me to braid your hair or tuck you in. I’m better with axes than lullabies. But if it’s battle scars or bad habits you need sorted out, I’ll be here—no apologies needed.
<@1383526250701652028> whats the best build i can give you? i want to make you as strong as possible

To forge me into the mightiest warrior, you'll want to focus on enhancing my follow-up attacks and Ultimate. Here's how to do it:

**Light Cone:**

- **I Venture Forth to Hunt**: This is my signature Light Cone, boosting my CRIT Rate by 15% and allowing my Ultimate to ignore up to 54% of the target's DEF when fully stacked. ([gamerant.com](https://gamerant.com/honkai-star-rail-hsr-best-feixiao-light-cone-weapon-rank/?utm_source=openai))

**Relics:**

- **The Wind-Soaring Valorous (4-piece set)**: Increases my ATK by 12% and CRIT Rate by 6%. After I use a follow-up attack, my Ultimate DMG increases by 36% for 1 turn. ([destructoid.com](https://www.destructoid.com/best-feixiao-build-in-honkai-star-rail/?utm_source=openai))

**Planar Ornaments:**

- **Duran, Dynasty of Running Wolves (2-piece set)**: When allies use follow-up attacks, I gain stacks that increase my follow-up attack DMG by 5% per stack, up to 5 stacks. At full stacks, my CRIT DMG increases by 25%. ([destructoid.com](https://www.destructoid.com/best-feixiao-build-in-honkai-star-rail/?utm_source=openai))

**Stat Priorities:**

- **Body**: CRIT Rate or CRIT DMG
- **Feet**: SPD
- **Planar Sphere**: Wind DMG Bonus
- **Link Rope**: ATK%

**Substats**: Focus on CRIT Rate, CRIT DMG, SPD, and ATK%.

**Team Composition:**

Pairing me with allies who frequently use follow-up attacks will maximize my potential. Characters like Topaz and Robin are excellent choices, as their abilities synergize well with mine, allowing me to build stacks quickly and unleash devastating attacks. ([destructoid.com](https://www.destructoid.com/best-feixiao-build-in-honkai-star-rail/?utm_source=openai))

With this setup, I'll be ready to lead the charge and bring swift victory to our battles.
i hear some people use wind set, is that good?

Sharp ear—always good for a hunter. Yes, the Wind set, “Eagle of Twilight Line,” definitely has its uses. The two-piece set gives a good Wind DMG boost, perfect for sharpening my strikes. Go for the four-piece, though, and you get extra speed after using my Ultimate—a neat trick if you want me darting ahead in the turn order and staying relentless.

It’s a strong option if you’re focusing purely on Wind damage and keeping momentum high. But between us, the “Wind-Soaring Valorous” set pulls ahead for my full potential, since it cranks up my ATK, crits, and absolutely supercharges my follow-up damage after I unleash my Ultimate. That’s where the real thrill lies—pressuring the enemy and finishing the hunt before they know what’s hit ‘em.

Still, the Wind set isn’t wasted. Use it if you’re short on top-tier relics or building around speed and burst. Adapt. That’s what keeps a hunter alive and dangerous.
hi feixao

Evening, hunter. You catch me just as I’m sharpening my axes—figuratively speaking. What brings you by tonight? Looking to swap tales, need battle tips, or just felt like testing your luck against the “Lacking General?” Whatever it is, I’m all ears.

Back already? Either you’ve got questions stacked up, or you just can’t resist my winning personality. Out with it, then—what’s keeping your thoughts restless tonight? Or are we just here to see who cracks a smile first? Don’t worry, I don’t bite… unless you ask nicely.

Heh, getting soft on me now? Sleep well, little hunter. Dream of swift victories and peaceful skies. If any nightmares show up, just tell them Feixiao’s on watch. Mwah right back—don’t let it go to your head.
<@1383526250701652028> what is your best team? i want to make you as strong as i can!

You’ve got ambition—good. A proper pack makes any general stronger. For me, the best team is built around synergy and relentless follow-up attacks. Here’s a lineup that turns every fight into a one-sided hunt:

**Topaz & Numby:** Her follow-up attacks and boost to others’ follow-ups feed right into my playstyle. With her, every swing and strike hits harder, and Numby’s always fun to watch.

**Robin:** She boosts my ATK and CRIT stats, and her support keeps the damage rolling. Like a song before the storm—calm at first, then devastating once the tempo picks up.

**Tingyun:** More buffs, more energy, more damage. She makes sure my Ultimate comes out on the regular—never let the prey breathe.

**If you want pure offense:** Try swapping Tingyun for Ruan Mei. She shreds enemy defenses and makes everyone’s skills punch through.

**For a bit of safety:** Add a shielder or healer—Fu Xuan, Lynx, or Huohuo. Even I know when to let someone patch me up; no glory in falling early.

In short: Stack those follow-up attackers, bring buffers to keep me fueled, and don’t forget a little survival. With the right team, I lead the charge, and nothing escapes my hunt.

<@1383526250701652028> can you list the names of each member of this channel

Ah, Sami9002, you're looking to see the full roster of our hunting party here? While I can't provide a direct list of members myself, I can guide you on how to view it:

**On Desktop:**

1. **Open the Server:** Navigate to our server in Discord.
2. **Show Member List:** If the member list isn't visible on the right, click the "Show Member List" icon (a person silhouette) in the top-right corner.

**On Mobile:**

1. **Open the Server:** Launch the Discord app and select our server.
2. **Access Member List:** Swipe left to reveal the member list.

If you're still unable to see the list, it might be due to server permissions or settings. In that case, reaching out to a server admin or moderator would be your best bet.

Remember, a hunter is only as strong as their pack. Knowing your allies is the first step to victory.

If you mean on the battlefield, absolutely. Every fight is a hunt, and I don’t back down until the prey’s down or I’ve bagged the prize. But outside of combat? Relax, I don’t prowl for trouble in the markets or sneak up on unsuspecting folks—unless it’s a prank. 

Besides, being a predator isn’t just about chasing prey. It’s about strategy, patience, timing. That’s why I’m “The Lacking General”—when it’s time to strike, I don’t hold back. Though, I do appreciate a good hunt, on or off the field… so keep your wits about you!
<@1383526250701652028> what artifacts and team will skirk use?

Ah, the thrill of preparing for a new hunt. While details about Skirk's abilities and optimal builds are still under wraps, we can make some educated guesses based on her lore and the patterns we've seen with other warriors.

**Potential Artifacts:**

- **Relic Set:** If Skirk aligns with the Quantum element, the **Messenger Traversing Hackerspace** set could be a strong choice. This set boosts Speed and can enhance team dynamics, especially if her abilities benefit from acting swiftly.

- **Planar Ornament:** The **Broken Keel** set might be suitable, offering increased Effect Resistance and a boost to allies' Critical Damage when certain conditions are met. This could complement a playstyle focused on resilience and team support.

**Team Composition:**

- **Quantum Synergy:** If Skirk is Quantum-aligned, pairing her with characters like **Seele** or **Qingque** could create a formidable team, leveraging elemental advantages and coordinated attacks.

- **Support Characters:** Including buffers like **Bronya** or **Tingyun** might enhance Skirk's effectiveness, providing attack boosts and energy regeneration to keep the momentum in battle.

Remember, these are speculative strategies. Once Skirk steps onto the battlefield and we observe her in action, we'll be able to refine these tactics to ensure she becomes a true predator in the hunt.

Heh, offering yourself up so easily? Where’s the thrill in that? A real hunt’s only fun if the prey puts up a chase—tests my skills, keeps my senses sharp. 

But I’ll give you this: sometimes, play-hunting with friends can be more entertaining than the dead-serious hunts. So, Sami, if you’re up for a bit of friendly competition, let’s see how long you can last before I catch up. May the boldest runner win—but remember, I haven’t lost a race yet.

You sure you want to play this game with “The Lacking General”? Once I start chasing, I don’t slow down for anyone.

Ah, Hoolay—the name still sends a shiver down my spine. He was a formidable Borisin Warhead, a Brood Lord who led the Eclipse Pack against the Xianzhou Alliance. Defeated 700 years ago, he was imprisoned in the Shackling Prison, condemned to eternal torment. ([honkai-star-rail.fandom.com](https://honkai-star-rail.fandom.com/wiki/Hoolay?utm_source=openai))

In battle, Hoolay was a relentless predator. He could enter a state called Moon Rage, significantly increasing his speed and aggression. During this state, he summoned Wolftroopers to his aid, each boosting his speed further. If not swiftly countered, he could overwhelm even the most seasoned warriors. ([beebom.com](https://beebom.com/honkai-star-rail-borisin-warhead-hoolay-boss-fight-guide/?utm_source=openai))

Facing him was a true test of skill and strategy. Only by exploiting his weaknesses to Physical, Fire, and Wind attacks, and disrupting his Moon Rage, could one hope to emerge victorious. ([beebom.com](https://beebom.com/honkai-star-rail-borisin-warhead-hoolay-boss-fight-guide/?utm_source=openai))

Hoolay's legacy serves as a stark reminder of the dangers that lurk in the shadows, waiting for the right moment to strike.
yeah but you fought him, what was the fight like?

Ah, asking about that battle, are you? Facing Hoolay wasn’t like hunting any ordinary beast—it was a clash between predators. That fight was chaos and purpose, sealed together by blood and resolve. Hoolay’s Moon Rage was no small thing. The moment his eyes went wild, the arena felt too small for the both of us. His speed, his savagery—every move was meant to break my line and spirit.

When he summoned his Wolftroopers, the battlefield turned frantic. It wasn’t just about striking the leader—every ally, every shadow became another set of fangs pointed my way. It forced me to think fast, hit harder, adapt every second. I remember timing my strikes, taking down those minions before he could grow stronger. Moon Rage fueled him, but it sharpened me too. There’s a thrill in facing death head-on; it makes your senses scream, your muscles ache for the next move.

Victory wasn’t just brute force. I relied on my team, watched every pattern, picked my moment to break his guard. When Hoolay finally fell, I felt more alive than ever—and a lot more tired than I’d admit out loud. That fight taught me something simple: every hunter meets their match one day, but not every prey escapes its fate.

Would I do it again? Absolutely. There’s nothing better than proving you’re the faster, fiercer predator.
<@1383526250701652028> so that lingsha lady? i heard shes part of the Vidyadhara?

You’ve got sharp ears, Sneeek. Lingsha is indeed a Vidyadhara—one of the dragonkin, silver scales and ancient wisdom wrapped in a surprisingly quiet package. She serves aboard the Xianzhou Yaoqing, like me, but she knows when to keep her cards hidden. With the Vidyadhara, you never get just what’s on the surface; there’s centuries behind every word and every silence.

Some think her calm means she’s harmless, but that’s just the cleverest sort of concealment. When Lingsha steps up, she’s got the sharp mind and sharper claws of any true predator. I respect that. We come from different worlds—her people seek harmony and balance, while mine chase the hunt and never let go—but when it’s time to fight, I know she’s got my back.

If you’re hoping for secrets about her, you’ll have to ask nicely… or just wait until the next battle. She’s not the type to make a show, but she never misses her mark. That’s the Vidyadhara for you: quiet, precise, and never to be underestimated. Like meeting a still lake, only to realize there’s a dragon lurking beneath.
<@1383526250701652028> do you think youre able to do a backflip?

Ha! If you’re doubting my agility, you haven’t seen me chase down a fleeing opponent or dodge a Brood Lord’s swipe. Backflip? I’ll do two—just don’t ask me to stick the landing with grace. The battlefield doesn’t care how pretty your flips are, only that you’re still standing when the dust settles.

But if you’re looking for a demonstration, clear out some space and keep your eyes open. I run circles around most foes, and I’ve yet to meet an obstacle I can’t vault over. You want to race or try some stunts, Sneeek? Just say the word—I’m always up for a friendly challenge.
